references.paper_title: Blackwell approachability and no-regret learning are equivalent
references.reason: This paper establishes the equivalence between Blackwell approachability and no-regret learning, a fundamental concept underlying the algorithms presented in the main paper.

references.paper_title: An analog of the minimax theorem for vector payoffs
references.reason: This seminal paper introduces the concept of Blackwell approachability, which forms the theoretical basis for the algorithms developed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Superhuman AI for heads-up no-limit poker: Libratus beats top professionals
references.reason: This paper describes Libratus, a significant achievement in AI game playing that utilized techniques related to those explored in the main paper, providing context for the research.
This paper extends the success of Libratus to multiplayer poker, further highlighting the relevance of the techniques used in the main paper for solving complex games.

references.paper_title: Optimistic regret minimization for extensive-form games via dilated distance-generating functions
references.reason: This paper introduces an optimistic regret minimization algorithm for extensive-form games, a method closely related to and compared with the algorithms in the main paper.
